docs.lead_paragraph: From all the brouhaha over this week’s C.B.O. report, it seems as if job losses are the new death panels when it comes to attacking health reform.
docs.abstract: Paul Krugman Op-Ed column rejects reaction by critics of the health care reform law to new Congressional Budget Office report about its effects on the labor market; holds it is latest falsehood in ever-mendacious campaign against health reform; disputes notion the report is suggesting that health care reform will put millions of Americans out of work.
docs.snippet: From all the brouhaha over this week’s C.B.O. report, it seems as if job losses are the new death panels when it comes to attacking health reform.

docs.lead_paragraph: The number of new claims for unemployment benefits fell more than expected last week, but the trade deficit widened by 12 percent in December.

headline.main: Solid Jobs Data Is Tempered by Report on Weak Exports
headline.print_headline: Solid Jobs Data Is Tempered by Report on Weak Exports

docs.abstract: Labor Department reports that initial claims for weekly unemployment benefits declined by more-than-expected 20,000 to seasonally adjusted 331,000; Commerce Department reports that the trade deficit widened by 12 percent in December to $38.7 billion, in part because of the largest decline in exports since October 2012
docs.snippet: The number of new claims for unemployment benefits fell more than expected last week, but the trade deficit widened by 12 percent in December.

docs.lead_paragraph: One proposal would bring back pensions while a plan by the Obama administration would give younger people a break on market risk.
docs.abstract: Floyd Norris High & Low Finance column examines long decline of the pensions system and whether it can ever again be a part of corporate America; considers new IRA proposal by the Obama administration that would protect young investors against market risk, and an alternate proposal from Sen Tom Harkin that would guarantee monthly payments while reducing long-term burdens on companies and municipalities.
docs.snippet: One proposal would bring back pensions while a plan by the Obama administration would give younger people a break on market risk.

docs.lead_paragraph: More than 130 people, including 104 police officers, were injured on Thursday in a second day of anti-government demonstrations in the Bosnian town of Tuzla, as protests over unemployment and political inertia spread across the country.
